comments.author: jacob.benoit.1@gmail.com
comments.text:
Repeatedly reloading about:memory got me this crash:

firefox-bin: /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/db/sqlite3/src/sqlite3.c:12616: sqlite3_db_status: Assertion `0' failed.

Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
0x00007ffff2bf8165 in *__GI_raise (sig=<value optimized out>)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
64      ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
        in ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c
Current language:  auto
The current source language is "auto; currently c".

    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:64
#1  0x00007ffff2bfaf70 in *__GI_abort () at abort.c:92

    file=<value optimized out>, line=12616, function=0x7ffff29ae490 "sqlite3_db_status")
    at assert.c:81
#3  0x00007ffff28d9321 in sqlite3_db_status (db=0x1a19c98, op=2, pCurrent=0x7fffffff92a4, 
    pHighwater=0x7fffffff92a0, resetFlag=0)
    at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/db/sqlite3/src/sqlite3.c:12616
#4  0x00007ffff5d849a8 in mozilla::storage::StorageMemoryReporter::GetMemoryUsed (this=0xa97710, 
    memoryUsed=0x7fffffff9530)
    at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/storage/src/mozStorageConnection.cpp:410
#5  0x00007ffff61d8f9a in NS_InvokeByIndex_P (that=0xa97710, methodIndex=5, paramCount=1, 
    params=0x7fffffff9530)
    at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/xpcom/reflect/xptcall/src/md/unix/xptcinvoke_x86_64_unix.cpp:195
#6  0x00007ffff5a11408 in CallMethodHelper::Invoke (this=0x7fffffff94f0)
    at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/js/src/xpconnect/src/xpcwrappednative.cpp:3141
#7  0x00007ffff5a0f3fd in CallMethodHelper::Call (this=0x7fffffff94f0)

    at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/js/src/xpconnect/src/xpcwrappednativejsops.cpp:1660
#11 0x00007ffff667a99c in js::CallJSNative (cx=0x14feb70,

    native=0x7ffff5a1b25f <XPC_WN_GetterSetter(JSContext*, unsigned int, jsval_layout*)>, argc=0, 
    vp=0x7fffe2a751e8) at /home/bjacob/mozilla-central/js/src/jscntxtinlines.h:277

Current language:  auto
The current source language is "auto; currently c".

comments.text: I wonder if this is related to bug 654573.

comments.raw_text: Possibly.  It'd be interesting to know which database this is for.
